title: KYOTO: KAF Inspector
caption:
The KAF Inspector is a graphical environment in which experts of computational linguistics can inspect and debug documents annotated in KAF (Knowledge Annotation Format - [Bosma et al. 2009](http://www.researchgate.net/publication/228922488_KAF_a_generic_semantic_annotation_format/file/9fcfd50a355ff71027.pdf)), a text annotation format originally developed for [the KYOTO european project](http://kyoto-project.eu/xmlgroup.iit.cnr.it/kyoto/index.html).

Different annotation layers can be navigated akin to web pages thanks to the use of [Hash URIs](http://www.w3.org/blog/2011/05/hash-uris/), while more complex queries to an entire document base can be performed in SQL.

Since the end of KYOTO, the Inspector has been used again in other Italian and European projects (e.g. [CAPER](http://www.fp7-caper.eu/)). Read more about it in this quite old [technical report](home/docs/public/kafinspector.pdf).
